results.title: Pressure groups in action
results.creator_credit: Marbury Ogle, Republic Steel Corporation and Cinecraft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
Dr Marbury Ogle says that man has always organised groups to help him achieve what was beyond the capacity of one person. In America there are at least 300,000 formal and informal pressure groups, which try to direct, educate and motivate members, to win over the general public and to try to influence the government by lobbying. The lobbyist may act as a valuable informal consultant to a politician while his group may give minorities a chance to express their needs.

results.title: Pressing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Preserving and Drying of Plant Material”.
One of three films dealing with different aspects of preserving and drying of plant material, showing the techniques and everyday domestic equipment needed to achieve satisfactory results. This film deals with preservation by pressing.

results.title: President Soeharto in Australia, February 1972
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Don Murray
results.brief_description: The Indonesian President and his wife are seen arriving at Canberra, and at official functions in Parliament House, the Australian War Memorial, the Melbourne Arts Centre, Mary Mead Children’s Home, Taronga Zoo, the new Indonesian Chancery and other points of interest.

results.title: President Kennedy in Ireland, June 26-29, 1963
results.brief_description: Made by Irish Television, this is an account of President John F. Kennedy’s visit to Ireland in June 1963. It is a straight record of President Kennedy’s return to the land of his forefathers - we see the welcoming ceremony, the motorcade through the streets of Dublin, visits to other principal cities and the informal visit to the family home.

results.title: Preserving the Wasa
results.creator_credit: Douglas Gordon, Shell Film Unit and Michael Heckford
results.brief_description: An account of the location and salvaging of the Swedish warship Wasa which sank on its maiden voyage in Stockholm harbour in 1628. Explains the use of the petroleum product Polythlene glycol in the preservation of the wood of the Wasa. It diffuses through the wood cells - forcing out the water and sets hard.

results.title: Preserving our national heritage
results.creator_credit: Cine Service, Balm Paints and Lawrence Reese
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the work of the National Trust and affiliated bodies. Describes how they are preserving, marking and in some cases making available to the public in various states, Australia’s historic buildings, Aboriginal relics, and rare native flora and fauna. Narrated by John Royle.

results.title: Preserving Egypt's past
results.brief_description: Reveals many of the impressive monuments built by the ancient Egyptians such as the pyramids at Giza and the temples at Karnak, Luxor and Abu Simbal: it also looks at the enormous task faced by archaeologists and Egyptologists in their struggle to preserve the artifacts of Egypt’s past, which are deteriorating at an alarming rate due to population increase, tourism and the Nile’s rising waters. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels. Includes teacher’s guide.

results.title: Presenting Standard Triumph
results.brief_description: Survey of the Standard-Triumph motor car works, Describes the design, construction, assembly and testing of current range of automobiles. Advanced automation is used in the workshops including a Leo computer. Shows contribution of research teams to the development and design of new models.
